page.title: 19ECOLOGY
page.content: {CLIMATE:}The climate is variable and is affected by the sea(Maritime conditions)so we don't get any extremes in temperature.The average over the last 30 years for January are 2/3c,July is 14/15c.Compared with the rest of the country,there is a very low precipitation count of 750mm per annum.{POLLUTION:}Pollution is high because of the chemical works. Successful attempts have been made to lower the pollution in recent years Other pollution consists of carfumes, general litter and a small amount of graffiti,there has also been some unauthorised dumping of rubbish. {WILDLIFE:}The area we covered had a variety of plant and insect life.We found leaf eaters E.g.the Burnett moth seen more as a caterpillar,and we collected a sap-sucking Greenfly.We also found a Cantharus Rustica.
